item.text: Before the outbreak of Corona, would you say your health was excellent, very good, good, fair, or poor?

Since we last interviewed you, were you diagnosed with a major illness or health condition?

Do you have any of the following illnesses or health conditions? Please answer yes or no: IWER: With this we mean that a doctor has told you that you have this condition, and that you are either currently being treated for or bothered by this condition. IWER: READ OUT. Hip fracture?

IWER: READ OUT. A heart attack including myocardial infarction or coronary thrombosis or any other heart problem including congestive heart failure?

item.text: Since the outbreak of Corona, have you ever left your home?

Since the outbreak of Corona, how often have you done the following activities, as compared to before the outbreak? Not any more, less often, about the same, or more often? IWER: Read out each activity and check the appropriate answer. Going shopping?

Since the outbreak of Corona, how often have you done the following activities, as compared to before the outbreak? Not any more, less often, about the same, or more often? IWER: Read out each activity and check the appropriate answer. Going out for a walk?

item.text: At the time when Corona broke out, were you employed or self-employed, including working for family business?
Due to the Corona crisis have you become unemployed, were laid off or had to close your business? IWER: Business closure can be both temporarily or permanently.
How long were you unemployed, laid off or had to close your business? IWER: Number in weeks.

answerOption.valueString: Worked at the usual work place
Worked from home and at the usual work place

item.text: Since the outbreak of Corona, some people worked at home, some at their usual work place outside their home, some both. How would you describe your situation? IWER: If R got unemployed, laid off, or had to close business since the outbreak, R should think of the remaining time he or she worked during the outbreak. None of these means that did not work at all, neither at the usual workplace nor at home.
Did you learn new computer skills?
Was your Internet connection adequate?
Did you get any protection such as masks, gloves, protective screens, disinfection fluid at the work place?
How safe did you feel health-wise at your work place?
How many hours per week did you normally work before the outbreak of Corona? Please include overtime.
Did you reduce your working hours since the outbreak of Corona? IWER: If R got unemployed, laid off, or had to close business, code 'Yes'.
What was the lowest number of hours in a single week? IWER: If R got unemployed, laid off, or had to close business, put 0 hours.
When was that? [lowest number of hours]
In which week of the month was that? [lowest number of hours]
Did you increase your working hours since the outbreak of Corona? Please include overtime.
What was the highest number of hours in a single week? [increase in working hours]
When was that? [increase in working hours]
In which week of the month was that? [increase in working hours]

Since the outbreak of Corona, did you face more difficulties in getting the amount of home care that you need?

item.text: Did the people who cared for you wear protective devices such as masks or gloves? [home care]

We now come to the end of the interview. These were a lot of questions about a hard time. But even during hard times there are some good things in life. What was your most uplifting experience since the outbreak of Corona, in other words, something that inspired hope or happiness? IWER: DO NOT READ OUT. Let respondent answer and choose appropriate option.
Finally, what is it that you are looking most forward to doing once Corona abates? IWER: DO NOT READ OUT. Let respondent answer and choose appropriate option.
IWER: Please enter any remarks about this interview you want to tell us.
IWER CHECK: Who answered the questions?

title: Data Dictionary for the WHO Europe's Questionnaire on COVID-19 Behaviour
description: This is a data dictionary based on the questionnaire included in the WHO Europe's 'Survey tool and guidance: rapid, simple, flexible behavioural insights on COVID-19'. This data dictionary is prepared for upload into OPAL/MICA applications of the OBiBa (Open Source Software for BioBanks) software suite. The variables are annotated with metadata using the variable classification taxonomy developed by Maelstrom Research. Further information about format and applications can be found in Doiron et al. (2017; https://doi.org/10.1093/ije/dyx180).
copyright: All rights reserved by World Health Organization (WHO). Please contact the authors/contact persons to get permission to reuse the data dictionary in whole or parts of it.
